bge.math

Class Vector2

  • java.lang.Object
    • bge.math.Vector2

  • public class Vector2
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for representing a Vector with 2 components. Commonly used for 2D transformations that affect the screen. Created by Yannic Siebenhaar on 20.07.2015.

      • Vector2

        public Vector2()
        Constructs a new Vector. All components are set to 0.0f.

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set(float x,
                float y)
        Setter method to set all values of the Vector. If you want to set a single value, use the public property.
        Parameters:
        x - The x component of a Vector.
        y - The y component of a Vector.

      • add

        public Vector2 add(Vector2 rhs)
        Performs an addition with another Vector. This operation returns a new Vector which contains the calculated data.
        Parameters:
        rhs - A Vector as right hand side argument.
        Returns:
        A new Vector that holds the result.

      • sub

        public Vector2 sub(Vector2 rhs)
        Performs a subtraction with another Vector. This operation returns a new Vector which contains the calculated data.
        Parameters:
        rhs - A Vector as right hand side argument.
        Returns:
        A new Vector that holds the result.

      • mul

        public Vector2 mul(Vector2 rhs)
        Performs a multiplication with another Vector. This operation returns a new Vector which contains the calculated data.
        Parameters:
        rhs - A Vector as right hand side argument.
        Returns:
        A new Vector that holds the result.

      • mul

        public Vector2 mul(float rhs)
        Performs a multiplication with a float value. All components are multiplicated with given value. This operation returns a new Vector which contains the calculated data.
        Parameters:
        rhs - The number.
        Returns:
        A new Vector that holds the result.

      • div

        public Vector2 div(Vector2 rhs)
        Performs a division with another Vector. This operation returns a new Vector which contains the calculated data.
        Parameters:
        rhs - A Vector as right hand side argument.
        Returns:
        A new Vector that holds the result.

      • length

        public float length()
        Calculates the length of the Vector and returns the result as floating point number.
        Returns:
        The length of the Vector.

      • dot

        public float dot(Vector2 rhs)
        Calculates the dot product of two Vectors and returns the result as floating point number.
        Parameters:
        rhs - Right hand side value to calculate dot product.
        Returns:
        The dot product of the Vector.

      • normalize

        public Vector2 normalize()
        Normalizes the Vector. Normalizing means dividing all components (x, y) by the length of a Vector. This Operation affects the Vector and changes data.
        Returns:
        The updated instance.

      • getNormalized

        public Vector2 getNormalized()
        Returns a new instance of the normalized Vector. Normalizing means dividing all components (x, y) by the length of a Vector. This Operation does not affects the Vector.
        Returns:
        A new instance of the normalized Vector.

      • distance

        public float distance(Vector2 rhs)
        Calculates the distance of two Vectors.
        Parameters:
        rhs - Right hand side value to calculate the distance.
        Returns:
        The distance as floating point number.

      • parseVector

        public static Vector2 parseVector(Vector4 rhs)
        Converts a Vector4 into a Vector2. The z and w components are ignored.
        Parameters:
        rhs - Vector which will be converted.
        Returns:
        A new Vector that contains data of the given Vector.

      • parseVector

        public static Vector2 parseVector(Vector3 rhs)
        Converts a Vector3 into a Vector2. The z component is ignored.
        Parameters:
        rhs - Vector which will be converted.
        Returns:
        A new Vector that contains data of the given Vector.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Converts Vector2 into a String. Useful for debugging.

        Returns:
        The converted String.
